"S. Mike Dierken" <mdierken@...> writes:

> If one of the REST principles is visibility into messages for key
> information - like authentication - then moving authentication out of the
> standard header and into custom cookies would then violate this aspect.
> 
> I found a Note on the W3C site about extending HTML FORM with authentication
> information - this would allow application authors to declare their usage of
> authentication in a way that provides control over the user experience as
> well as allowing the user-agent to correctly translate that into protocol
> level authentication.
> 
> http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-authentform

Remember that for web services the existing model is not really
broken. 

It's only really broken in the way browsers work and the way
most marketing managers want the application to do authentication.

It's my belief that basic authentication could be fixed as a device
for doing web authentication if the user agents always displayed the
entity from the server.



Nic Ferrier
